item.title: TomTom introduces assistance for speed cameras and traffic congestion
item.description: The image displayed is a screenshot from the Android Play store showcasing the TomTom Speed Cameras app. This app provides information about mobile speed cameras. TomTom has recently launched a new feature called TomTom Jam Ahead Warnings for their free Android app, TomTom Speed Cameras. This feature utilizes visual and audio cues to notify drivers of sudden slowdowns or stopped traffic ahead on highways. This allows drivers time to brake safely and efficiently.

item.title: ValueChampion warns that driving in Singapore is more perilous than you might realize
item.description: While Singapore boasts one of the world’s lowest road fatality rates per person, ValueChampion suggests that driving in Singapore might be riskier than in other developed nations. Anastassia Evlanova, a Senior Research Analyst at ValueChampion Singapore, highlights in a recent blog post (which builds on research from 2017) that Singapore recorded 12.13 deaths per 100,000 vehicles in 2019, surpassing rates in Japan and Australia. She explains, “Looking at road safety solely based on deaths per capita creates a deceptive view of driving safety in Singapore.

item.title: Bricks and Mortar Apocolypse, Now?
item.description: The physical world is struggling while the virtual world thrives. We may be approaching a point where the internet becomes dominant, and traditional businesses may suffer for unexpected reasons. Retail has been declining, but recently, there’s been a sharp downturn due to rising gas prices. This discourages driving, which leads to less shopping. Shopping is crucial for the economy; a decline in shopping could lead to an economic depression. Our society relies heavily on driving.
